DOC.brief_summary: Life-threatening infection impairs bloodflow to the gut, thereby causing less delivery of oxygen. This leads to increased formation of different inflammatory and infectious markers. The investigators hypothesize, therefore, that there is a significant difference in the concentrations of inflammatory and infectious markers in the rectal mucosa between patients with septic shock and healthy controls.
DOC.brief_title: Barrier Function and Production of Inflammatory Cytokines in the Rectal Mucosa in Patients With Septic Shock
DOC.criteria: Septic shock Age < 18 years No next of kin Pathology of the descending or sigmoid colon or rectum Pregnancy 1st degree relatives with inflammatory bowel disease Severe coagulopathy
